title: How to Sew a Button on a Suit

steps.title: Choose a button that suits your suit.
steps.content: Choose a button that suits your suit. Make sure the button is the right shape, length and colour. If a button has just fallen off, you can sew it back on again. If you can't find the missing button, choose a button matches the others. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mark the place where you need to sew the button.
steps.content: Mark the place where you need to sew the button. Use a light pen or pencil. Mark a cross about three quarters of the size of your button. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Choose your thread.
steps.content: Choose your thread. Find something the same colour as the suit. Also make sure that it is the same thickness as the rest of the thread on the suit.

steps.title: Get a needle and thread it with your thread.
steps.content: Get a needle and thread it with your thread.

steps.title: Sew a couple of times through the cross to secure it.
steps.content: Sew a couple of times through the cross to secure it.

steps.title: Put a button hole through the needle and sew.
steps.content: Put a button hole through the needle and sew.

steps.title: Sew through each hole several times to secure the button.
steps.content: Sew through each hole several times to secure the button.

steps.title: Tie a knot at the underside of the suit.
steps.content: Tie a knot at the underside of the suit.
